title: Peter Shilton
summary: Peter Leslie Shilton OBE (born 18 September 1949) is an English former footballer who played as a goalkeeper. He currently holds the record for playing more games for the England men's team than anyone else, earning 125 caps, and holds the all-time record for the most competitive appearances in world football â€“ 1,390.[4][5][6] The IFFHS ranked Shilton among the top ten goalkeepers of the 20th century in 2000.[7]
